race.name: Dirty Hector
race.display_name: Dirty Hector - New York State Championship
race.tagline: New York State Championship gravel in Finger Lakes wine country.

terrain.surface: Rolling to hilly gravel roads through Finger Lakes wine country. Significant elevation.

gravel_god_rating.score_note: New York State Championship. Significant climbing but regional field and low altitude.

biased_opinion.verdict: New York State Championship Hills Challenge
biased_opinion.summary: Dirty Hector is New York's State Championship gravel race in the beautiful Finger Lakes wine country. The state championship status elevates it above typical regional events, and the Finger Lakes hills provide genuine climbing challenges with 5000 feet of elevation. Trumansburg is a small wine country town with decent amenities. It's well-organized for a state championship with moderate field size.
biased_opinion.bottom_line: A solid New York State Championship gravel race with genuine climbing challenges in beautiful wine country. Worth it for New York cyclists seeking state championship status. Not a destination race for out-of-state travelers, but a good state-level event.

final_verdict.one_liner: New York State Championship gravel with significant climbing in Finger Lakes.
final_verdict.should_you_race: If you're in New York and want state championship status—yes, it's a well-organized event with genuine climbing. If you're from out of state—there are more prestigious events elsewhere.
final_verdict.alternatives: For better Northeast events: Rasputitsa, Vermont Overland, Grinduro. For similar state championships: other state championship events.

logistics.lodging_strategy: Trumansburg has wine country lodging. Ithaca (45 min) has more options.
logistics.food: Wine country town with good dining options.

history.origin_story: New York State Championship gravel event in Finger Lakes.

course_description.character: Rolling to hilly gravel through Finger Lakes wine country.
course_description.signature_challenge: 5000 feet of climbing through Finger Lakes hills.

non_negotiables.why: 5000 feet of climbing requires strong aerobic capacity and climbing fitness.
New York weather means rain is possible. Prepare for wet conditions.

marketplace_variables.race_hook: 62 miles of New York State Championship gravel with 5000 feet of climbing.
marketplace_variables.race_hook_detail: State championship event in Finger Lakes wine country.

logistics.explanation: Silver Queen Farm provides proper start/finish venue with 11am mass start format and aid station stocked with water and Flow Formulas electrolyte mix at mile 20. Race director Lauren McKinzey managed 130 racers through challenging muddy conditions, though GPS is 'HIGHLY recommended due to poor reception throughout the route.'

length.explanation: Jack Bernhard's winning time of 2:17:07 averaged 17.5 mph over 40 miles with 3,700 feet of climbing. Masters winners finished in the 2:22-2:40 range while recreational finishers reached 4+ hours, showing how technical terrain creates significant time separation across ability levels. Similar distance to Crusher in the Tushar.

technicality.explanation: Organizers warn 'This race is CHALLENGING and FUN!! It may be MUDDY, it will be HARD, it is BEAUTIFUL and will take GRIT to get through.' Course features water crossings, fence crossings through cow fields, and technical singletrack where Jack Bernhard's cyclocross skills proved decisive. Less technical than The Mid South. As Lauren McKinzey (Race Director) puts it: "With weeks of wet weather leading up to the start of the race, the course was extremely muddy and made for some challenging racing on rutted back roads and technical singletrack for the 130 racers."

elevation.explanation: The 3,700 feet of climbing over 40 miles through Finger Lakes National Forest delivers sustained punishment that separates fitness levels effectively. Winners maintained sub-2:20 times while mid-pack struggled past 3 hours, with the technical terrain amplifying elevation's impact. More climbing than SBT GRVL at the same score.

climate.explanation: Historical weather data shows average highs of 68°F and lows of 47°F, with a 49% chance of rain on any given day. Race director Lauren McKinzey reported 'weeks of wet weather leading up to the start of the race' made the 2025 course 'extremely muddy' with 'rutted back roads and technical singletrack.' May conditions in the Finger Lakes remain unpredictable for course preparation. More weather exposure than Belgian Waffle Ride San Diego. As Lauren McKinzey (Race Director) puts it: "With weeks of wet weather leading up to the start of the race, the course was extremely muddy and made for some challenging racing on rutted back roads and technical singletrack for the 130 racers."

altitude.explanation: Trumansburg sits around 1,000 feet above sea level in the Finger Lakes region. This elevation poses no physiological challenge for riders from any background. Lower altitude than Gravel Worlds — no thin-air concerns.

adventure.explanation: The course winds through creeks, forests, and requires fence crossings in cow fields with 'gravel meets cyclocross' terrain through Finger Lakes National Forest. However, it's focused competitive racing rather than exploratory adventure that builds lasting memories beyond finishing.

prestige.explanation: NYS Gravel State Championship status in 2025 drew competitive depth with elite winner Jack Bernhard and sponsored riders. The 131-finisher field with 3-deep category prizes shows regional significance, though it lacks national destination event recognition.

race_quality.explanation: Mass start format with proper timing and results. Aid station stocked with water and race-specific electrolyte mix. Course marked with GPS backup recommended. Ruth Sherman, 66, finished 42nd overall showing the event accommodates wide ability ranges while maintaining competitive structure.

experience.explanation: Post-race features Babe's Burgers food truck, beer, and ice cream at Silver Queen Farm after completing what organizers call 'one-of-a-kind and totally worth it.' The 2025 edition was deemed 'a great success' despite challenging muddy conditions throughout.

community.explanation: Black Pearl Bikes organizes to 'showcase our unique and beautiful Finger Lakes home' with strong NYSBRA organizational backing for the state championship. Organizers reference return participation by telling potential riders to 'just ask anyone who raced last year.'

field_depth.explanation: The 131 finishers included competitive racing up front with elite winner Jack Bernhard and masters category depth across age groups. Ruth Sherman's victory in Open Women at age 66 shows participation range, though it remains regional rather than national-level depth. Less competitive depth than Almanzo 100.

value.explanation: State championship racing through technical mixed terrain with proper post-race amenities including food truck and beer. The challenging 40-mile course with significant climbing delivers what organizers promise as 'one-of-a-kind and totally worth it' complete experience for the entry fee.

expenses.explanation: Registration runs $80-120. Rural Trumansburg location keeps accommodation costs reasonable compared to destination events, though advance planning needed for limited lodging options. No major airport proximity means driving for most participants, helping control overall travel expenses in the Finger Lakes region. Similar expense level to Belgian Waffle Ride San Diego.

primary.name: Specialized Pathfinder Pro
primary.why: Fast center, grippy edges. The modern all-rounder benchmark.

primary.name: Vittoria Terreno Mix
primary.why: Graphene versatility. Mixed-terrain grip with reasonable rolling speed.

front_rear_split.rationale: Faster front for reduced rolling resistance on straights, grippier rear for traction on loose climbs and corners
